column4: I installed Lucid and Grub to an external hard drive, but whenever I boot to the hard drive, the grub rescue screen appears. I have tried installing grub onto the drive from ubuntu, another copy of which I have on my internal drive, and manually replacing the grub folder as root, both without success
exactly what do you get on screen
instead of the bootloader, it says GRUB rescue >
ok, so your grub is looking at the wrong partitions for it's menu info
probably becuase you're using a USB drive and it didn't work out the install info properly
I reinsatlled it via the terminal on ubuntu on my internal drive
then you've installed it to look at the wrong places
so the automatic installation went wrong... :( I can maually edit grub.cfg, then, I guess
so how should I reconfigure it?
ok, so then you understand how to point grub at the right parrtitions
then you've not configured it right, or the ubuntu partition is corrupt/damaged
damn... well, I'll give it another shot
